etymology.description: 说(說) (shuō, "speak") = 言(言) (yán, "speech") + 兌(兌) (duì, "exchange") — the act of speaking or exchanging words
etymology.interpretation: This makes intuitive sense as 言(言) (yán, "speech") indicates the action of speaking, while 兌(兌) (duì, "exchange") suggests the back-and-forth nature of conversation.
etymology.simplification: The character was simplified by reducing the number of strokes and substituting the component 言 with its cursive version 讠.

examples.chinese: 他说(他說)今天很忙(今天很忙)。
examples.pinyin: tā shuō(他說) jīntiān hěn máng(今天很忙)。
examples.english: He said(他說) he is very busy(今天很忙) today.

examples.chinese: 我想(我想)说(說)几句话(幾句話)。
examples.pinyin: wǒ xiǎng(我想) shuō(說) jǐ jù huà(幾句話)。
examples.english: I want(我想) to say(說) a few words(幾句話).
